H0.text: What African animals are traditionally considered the 'Big Five', originally the most difficult/dangerous to hunt on foot (one point each). Hippopotamus

H1.text: What African animals are traditionally considered the 'Big Five', originally the most difficult/dangerous to hunt on foot (one point each). Nile Crocodile

H2.text: What African animals are traditionally considered the 'Big Five', originally the most difficult/dangerous to hunt on foot (one point each). Hyena (Spotted)

H3.text: What African animals are traditionally considered the 'Big Five', originally the most difficult/dangerous to hunt on foot (one point each). Elephant, Rhinoceros, Lion, Leopard, Buffalo

A10.text: Lions pose a great mortal threat and can be responsible for 22% of leopard deaths in Sabi Sand Game Reserve.

A11.text: Leopards were dominant only over the cheetah while the others have the advantage of size, pack numbers or both.
